data.name: Peaches and Avocados
data.description:
### Problem Statement

> JUST NOW: Papapito's latest album "Boom Pow" had sold a million copies

You are a big fan of Papapito! He has the style, looks, voice, manners - everything a man or a woman wants. As a big fan, you went to a merchandise store to buy some of his merchandise.

Unfortunately, the nearest store was **CLOSED**!

With no hesitation, you bought a ticket at the train station and went to the next nearest store.

![image](https://s3.amazonaws.com/hr-challenge-images/0/1478272533-2514e7d229-ppap.png)

As you stroll through the store, shown above are the two things that really caught your attention: the peach pen and the avocado pen. The peach pen is priced at ```p_price``` pesos while the avocado pen is priced at ```a_price``` pesos. You wanted to buy those two as many as you can while buying at least one of each.

Currently, you have ```m``` pesos, and you have to decide how many of each pen you should buy to maximize your spending while buying at least one of each pen and can still buy a ticket worth ```t``` pesos to go back home.

### Task
Formally, given integers ```p_price, a_price, t, m``` where:
 > * ```p_price``` - price of each peach pen
 > * ```a_price``` - price of each avocado pen
 > * ```t``` - price of train ticket
 > * ```m``` - the current money you have

Define the function ```max_spend``` that returns the maximum amount of money you can spend in buying at least one of each pen such that you can still buy a ticket to go back home, and returns ```-1``` if it's impossible to buy at least one of each pen or if you can't go back home (before buying or even after buying).

### Constraints
 > * 1 <= ```p_price, a_price, t``` <= 100
 > * 1 <=  ```m``` <= 1000
 
### Examples
> * If ```p_price, a_price, t, m``` = `[10, 11, 1, 100]`, you can buy one peach pen and eight avocado pen, costing 98 pesos (1 * 10 + 8 * 11 = 98). You are left with 2 pesos and still can buy a ticket to go back home.
> * If ```p_price, a_price, t, m``` = `[10, 11, 3, 100]`, you can buy two peach pen and seven avocado pen, costing 97 pesos (2 * 10 + 7 * 11 = 97). You are left with 3 pesos and still can buy a ticket to go back home.
> * If ```p_price, a_price, t, m``` = `[2, 3, 1, 5]`, you can buy one of each pen, costing 5 pesos (2 + 3 = 5) but if you buy, you can't go back home due to lack of funds. So, this case is impossible.
> * If ```p_price, a_price, t, m``` = `[1, 1, 5, 4]`, you can't buy a ticket to go home. So, this case is impossible.
